title.narrative: ENHANCED QUALITY OF EDUCATION FOR IMPROVED LEARNING OUTCOMES.

description.narrative: Children, from early childhood to adolescence, including vulnerable children, have enhanced quality of education for improved learning outcomes., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized and those affected by humanitarian crises, are provided with inclusive and equitable qualityeducation and learning opportunities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children, from early childhood to adolescence, including vulnerable children, have enhanced quality of education for improvedlearning outcomes.

description.narrative: With UNICEF’s support, sector-based mentors, school-based mentors and teachers benefited from capacity development to improve their teaching methods while adopting play-based learning approaches. To support the rollout of play-based learning, UNICEF partnered with communications houses and media agencies to broadcast messages to mobilize policy, school and community stakeholders on the importance of play for children’s learning. In support of pre-service teacher training, UNICEF continued supporting teacher training colleges (TTC) to support effective training for pre-primary schoolteachers.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
